newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Contract extension sought for Koor chief.
newsitem.headline: Contract extension sought for Koor chief.

text.p: Shareholders of Koor Industries will be asked at a general meeting on March 25 to extend managing director Benjamin Gaon's contract another five years, a spokesman for the company said on Thursday.

The spokesman said the extension was timed to coincide with a five-year strategic plan that Gaon and Koor officials have nearly completed. He said the board wanted Gaon to oversee the plan's execution through the end of the year 2001.
The spokesman would not reveal any details of the strategic programme, which he said was due to be approved by Koor's board next month.
Gaon has been managing director of Koor since 1988. In the following years, he brought the holding company, Israel's largest, back from the brink of bankcruptcy.

In recent years, the company has focused on five core areas -- telecommunications, electronics, building products, agro-chemicals and energy distribution -- and has begun a process of forming strategic partnerships with multinationals for its operating companies.
The spokesman said the general terms of Gaon's contract would remain unchanged for the five-year period but added that they were subject to renegotiation on an annual basis.
